subject: Re: *** Idea: Configurable Test Case ***
msgSnippet: I have had a quick look at JXUnit. It works in a similar way, but seems too complex. I want something simple.. Cheers ... and JXQuick. ... (method ... data,
messageBody:
I have had a quick look at JXUnit. It works in a similar way, but
seems too complex. I want something simple..

Cheers

--- In junit@y..., Robert Leftwich <digital@i...> wrote:
> At 10:58 PM 7/11/2001 +0000, gavinlas@h... wrote:
> >Hello,
> >
> >I have been looking at creating a configurable test suite and test
> >cases.
> >
> >Snip...
> >All comments, advice or suggestions are welcome.
>
> You might want to take a look at JxUnit at
> http://sourceforge.net/projects/jxunit/ or
> http://quickutil.sourceforge.net/view/Main/JXUnit where it says:
>
> JXUnit is a directory-driven test scripting which builds on JUnit
and JXQuick.
> Test data plays a central role in testing. From the lowest level
(method
> tests) to the highest (acceptance tests), a test involves input
data,
> expected output data, and a comparison between the expected and
actual
> output data.
> JXUnit separates test data from test code. This has several
advantages:
> · Test data can be edited, making it easy to add additional
test cases;
> · Test data can be validated, as a means of reducing "false
> failures"; and
> · Test data can be externally generated or captured from a
production
> process.
>
> Robert
